STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
December 18, 2019
Saginaw Co Youth Prot Council
Po Box 3191
Saginaw, MI 48605
RE: License #: CB730201194
Innerlink Transitional Living Program
1110 Howard Street
Saginaw, MI 48601
Dear :
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
(date). The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Settlement Agreement (MSA)
requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations
of the MSA and your contract.
OR
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
(date). You have submitted an acceptable written corrective action plan covering the
violations cited in the report. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Settlement
Agreement (MSA) requirements. It should be noted that violations of any licensing rules
are also violations of the MSA and your contract.
OR
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on (date). Due
to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Settlement Agreement (MSA) requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It
should be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and
your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MSA citation.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
OR
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a six-month provisional license will
be issued. If you do not agree to a provisional license or fail to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan, disciplinary action will result.
OR
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
(date). The study has determined there are substantial violations of applicable licensing
statutes and rules, sections of the contract and Modified Settlement Agreement (MSA)
requirements. Therefore, revocation of the license OR license is recommended. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MSA and your
contract. You will be notified in writing of the Department’s intentions and your options
for resolution of this matter.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 975-5053.
Sincerely,
Venus Connors, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
411 Genesee
P.O. Box 5070
Saginaw, MI 48605
(517) 284-9747
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules
except for the following:
R 400.12404 Placement.
(6) Before the placement of a child, the agency shall
document preparation, regardless of the child's age, that
explains all of the following to all relevant parties:
(a) The circumstances necessitating placement.
R 400.12405 Change of placement.
(3) The agency shall document all of the following in the
child's record before a change of placement occurs:
(a) Reason for the change in placement.
R 400.12417 Foster parent information.
(1) An agency shall provide a foster parent with all of the
following information before the placement or replacement of a
child:
(a) Child's name.
R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(a) Within 30 calendar days from removal from the home.
4

R 400.12418 Development of service plans.
(2) An agency shall complete written service plans for each child
and parent or parents, as follows:
(b) Within 120 calendar days after the initial removal and at
least once every 90 calendar days thereafter.
R 400.12419 Initial service plans.
(1) The initial service plan, as required in R 400.12418(2)(a),
shall include all of the following information:
(a) Dates, types, and places of agency contacts and persons
contacted.
R 400.12420 Updated service plans.
(1) An updated service plan, as required in R 400.12418(2)(b),
shall include all of the following information:
(a) Dates, types, and places of agency contacts and persons
contacted.
R 400.12604 Orientation and application.
(1) An agency shall provide an orientation for prospective
applicants for adoption before an adoptive application is
provided. The orientation shall include a review of all of the
following:
(a) Program statement, policies, and procedures.
5

R 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation.
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a written
adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family signing an
adoption application and prior to approving a family for adoption.
6

2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MSA violation. Please note that there
are additional MSA requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional MSA requirements except for the following:
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:

V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this
licensing period.
OR
There were #### incidents of substantiated child abuse and/or neglect during
this licensing period.
[Describe and assess the agency’s overall handling of the foster home
associated with these incidents.]
There were #### incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this
licensing period.
[Describe and assess the agency’s overall handling of the foster home
associated with these incidents.]
AND
The agency has submitted #### acceptable corrective action plans not related
8

to maltreatment during this licensing period.
[Describe and assess the agency’s compliance with each individual Corrective
Action Plan for special investigations and licensing reviews].
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility continue on a regular license.
OR
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility continue on a
regular license.
OR
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon receipt of an
acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the agency license be
modified to a First Provisional license and/or a review of your contract will be sent to
Children’s Services Administration.
OR
Based on inspection findings the facility is in substantial non-compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MSA requirements and/or contract/policy. The
recommendation is revocation/refusal to renew of the agency license. A
revocation/refusal to renew of your license will cause your contract to be terminated.

Venus Connors Date
Licensing Consultant
